port_cleanup.description: Enable port cleanup before server start

server_pid.description: Process ID of the started server

auth_secret.description: Authentication secret used for the context

steps.name: Set Authentication Context
steps.run:
case "${{ inputs.auth_context }}" in
  "e2e")
    AUTH_SECRET="playwright-test-secret-key"
    ;;
  "monitoring")
    AUTH_SECRET="monitoring-secret-key"
    ;;
  "ci")
    AUTH_SECRET="ci-test-secret-key"
    ;;
  *)
    AUTH_SECRET="default-test-secret-key"
    ;;
esac

echo "auth_secret=$AUTH_SECRET" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
echo "NEXTAUTH_SECRET=$AUTH_SECRET" >> $GITHUB_ENV

echo "ğŸ”‘ Authentication context set: ${{ inputs.auth_context }}"
echo "ğŸ” Secret configured for context"

steps.name: Clean up port 3000
steps.run:
echo "ğŸ§¹ Cleaning up port 3000 before server startup..."

# Kill any existing processes on port 3000 to prevent conflicts
lsof -ti:3000 | xargs kill -9 2>/dev/null || true

# Wait briefly for port to be freed
sleep 2

echo "âœ… Port 3000 cleanup completed"

steps.name: Start Development Server
steps.run:
echo "ğŸš€ Starting development server for authentication context: ${{ inputs.auth_context }}"

# Create log directory
mkdir -p server-logs

# Start server with standardized authentication environment
NODE_ENV=test \
E2E_MOCK_AUTH_ENABLED=true \
NEXTAUTH_URL=http://localhost:3000 \
NEXT_PUBLIC_GITHUB_APP_NAME=pulse-summarizer \
NEXTAUTH_SECRET=${{ steps.set-context.outputs.auth_secret }} \
GITHUB_OAUTH_CLIENT_ID=mock-client-id \
GITHUB_OAUTH_CLIENT_SECRET=mock-client-secret \
npm run dev > server-logs/${{ inputs.auth_context }}-server.log 2>&1 &

# Store the process ID for cleanup
SERVER_PID=$!
echo $SERVER_PID > server.pid
echo "server_pid=$SERVER_PID" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT

echo "ğŸ“‹ Development server started with PID: $SERVER_PID"
echo "ğŸ“ Logs: server-logs/${{ inputs.auth_context }}-server.log"

# Wait for the server to be ready
echo "â³ Waiting for server to be ready (timeout: ${{ inputs.server_timeout }}ms)..."
node scripts/wait-for-server.js http://localhost:3000 ${{ inputs.server_timeout }} 1000

# Show last 20 lines of server log for debugging
echo "ğŸ“œ Server log (last 20 lines):"
tail -n 20 server-logs/${{ inputs.auth_context }}-server.log || true

steps.name: Check Authentication Endpoints
steps.run:
echo "ğŸ” Verifying NextAuth API endpoints are ready..."

# Run authentication health checks with configured timeout
node scripts/check-auth-health.js http://localhost:3000 ${{ inputs.health_check_timeout }} 1000

echo "âœ… Authentication endpoints verified successfully!"

steps.name: Validate Authentication Configuration
steps.run:
echo "ğŸ”¬ Running comprehensive authentication validation..."

# Create metrics directory for validation results
mkdir -p ci-metrics

# Run comprehensive authentication token validation
node scripts/ci/validate-auth-tokens.js http://localhost:3000 ${{ inputs.health_check_timeout }}

echo "âœ… Authentication validation completed!"

steps.name: Verify NextAuth Initialization
steps.run:
echo "ğŸ”§ Verifying NextAuth is fully initialized..."

# Verify NextAuth initialization and timing
node scripts/ci/verify-nextauth-initialization.js http://localhost:3000 45000 2000

echo "âœ… NextAuth initialization verification completed!"

server_pid.description: Process ID of the server to terminate

steps.name: Terminate Authentication Server
steps.run:
echo "ğŸ›‘ Terminating authentication server..."

# Try to get server PID from input or file
SERVER_PID="${{ inputs.server_pid }}"

if [ -z "$SERVER_PID" ] && [ -f "server.pid" ]; then
  SERVER_PID=$(cat server.pid)
  echo "ğŸ“‹ Found server PID in file: $SERVER_PID"
fi

if [ -n "$SERVER_PID" ]; then
  if kill -0 "$SERVER_PID" 2>/dev/null; then
    echo "ğŸ“‹ Terminating server with PID: $SERVER_PID"
    
    # Graceful shutdown first
    kill -TERM "$SERVER_PID" 2>/dev/null || true
    
    # Wait for graceful shutdown
    sleep 3
    
    # Force kill if still running
    if kill -0 "$SERVER_PID" 2>/dev/null; then
      echo "ğŸ”¨ Force terminating server..."
      kill -9 "$SERVER_PID" 2>/dev/null || true
    fi
    
    echo "âœ… Server terminated successfully"
  else
    echo "â„¹ï¸ Server with PID $SERVER_PID is not running"
  fi
else
  echo "âš ï¸ Server PID not found, checking for running processes..."
  
  # Try to find and kill any node processes on port 3000
  PORT_PIDS=$(lsof -ti:3000 2>/dev/null || true)
  if [ -n "$PORT_PIDS" ]; then
    echo "ğŸ” Found processes on port 3000: $PORT_PIDS"
    echo "$PORT_PIDS" | xargs kill -TERM 2>/dev/null || true
    sleep 2
    echo "$PORT_PIDS" | xargs kill -9 2>/dev/null || true
    echo "ğŸ§¹ Cleaned up port 3000"
  else
    echo "â„¹ï¸ No processes found on port 3000"
  fi
fi

steps.name: Cleanup Authentication Files
steps.run:
echo "ğŸ§¹ Cleaning up authentication setup files..."

# Clean up PID file
if [ -f "server.pid" ]; then
  rm server.pid
  echo "ğŸ—‘ï¸ Removed server.pid"
fi

# Show final server log summary if available
if [ -d "server-logs" ]; then
  echo "ğŸ“œ Server log summary:"
  for log in server-logs/*.log; do
    if [ -f "$log" ]; then
      echo "--- Log: $(basename "$log") ---"
      echo "Lines: $(wc -l < "$log")"
      echo "Size: $(du -h "$log" | cut -f1)"
      
      # Show last few lines for debugging
      echo "Last 10 lines:"
      tail -n 10 "$log" || true
      echo ""
    fi
  done
fi

echo "âœ… Authentication cleanup completed for context: ${{ inputs.auth_context }}"
